method.text: Rinse and dry the portions of duckling very thoroughly. Place on a rack in a roasting tin, with the skin side uppermost.
Cook the duckling portions in the oven for 20 min. Then gently prick the skin with a fine skewer, to let the fat run out. Return to the oven for 10 min, or until nearly tender.
Brush the skin with the honey and sprinkle the almonds on top. Cook for a further 10 min. Drain carefully before serving, reserving the fat.

Heat the fat or margarine in a pan, stir in the flour, cook for 1 min. Gradually stir in the stock. Bring to the boil and cook until slightly thickened. This will not be a very thick sauce. Add the port, honey and seasoning, then heat through just before serving.
Arrange the duckling on a warmed serving platter, garnished with watercress. Pour the sauce into a warmed jug. Serve with cranberry sauce.
